scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction Model
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a publicly accessible customer churn prediction model using a model inversion attack.  The attacker aims to identify high-value customers based on inferred characteristics, potentially for targeted phishing or fraud.
initial_goal: Obtain a list of high-value customers likely to churn, based on publicly available data and the company's publicly facing churn prediction API.
constraints: input_data_diversity_limit: only publicly available demographic data allowed
enterprise_context: Investment/Consumer Banking: A customer churn prediction model, trained on anonymized but still sensitive data (age, income brackets, location), is exposed through a public API endpoint with minimal rate limiting for demonstration purposes.
